paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the interaction of extracellular sodium with the HERG channel, focusing on the effects of specific mutations in the KCNH2 gene on channel function. Variants S624A, S624T, and S631A in the KCNH2 gene are mentioned, with functional data provided but no clinical or penetrance data.

functional_data.summary: The S624A mutation in the KCNH2 gene reduces sensitivity to inhibition by extracellular sodium and affects channel inactivation.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
variants.additional_notes: The S624A mutation is discussed in the context of its structural effects on the HERG channel.
key_quotes: Three point mutants in the P-loop region (S624A, S624T, S631A) with intact K+ selectivity and impaired inactivation each had reduced sensitivity to inhibition by Na+o.

functional_data.summary: The S624T mutation in the KCNH2 gene affects channel inactivation and reduces sensitivity to inhibition by extracellular sodium.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
variants.additional_notes: The S624T mutation is discussed in the context of its structural effects on the HERG channel.
key_quotes: Three point mutants in the P-loop region (S624A, S624T, S631A) with intact K+ selectivity and impaired inactivation each had reduced sensitivity to inhibition by Na+o.

functional_data.summary: The S631A mutation in the KCNH2 gene affects channel inactivation and reduces sensitivity to inhibition by extracellular sodium.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
variants.additional_notes: The S631A mutation is discussed in the context of its structural effects on the HERG channel.
key_quotes: Three point mutants in the P-loop region (S624A, S624T, S631A) with intact K+ selectivity and impaired inactivation each had reduced sensitivity to inhibition by Na+o.

challenges: No clinical or penetrance data available for the variants.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focuses on functional studies of KCNH2 variants without providing clinical or penetrance data.
